intro: Silene bernardina subsp. maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils in pine woodlands and disturbed areas. It has small, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
